td.content: s:pt presents w/ c/o 12 days h/o moderate hyperesthesia in lower limbs, severe weight loss and severe increased thirst. patient is a male aged 47 Ys. he has a history of smoking occasional EtOH o:Height 163 cm, Weight 71.8 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 18, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to endocrinology.

td.content: s:a 49 year old m reports moderate hyperesthesia in lower limbs, severe weight loss, Diabetes. Also complains of severe increased thirst from time to time. he has approx. a 30 pack/year history of smoking he reports having no more than one drink a day o:Height 162 cm, Weight 69.3 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 15, Basic Metabolic Panel BUN=30 mg/dL,creatinine=2 mg/dL, Arterial Blood Gas 6.0,HCO3=17 meq/L, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:administered insulin aspart - 100 mg/mL subcutaneous daily, performed Basic Metabolic Panel, Arterial Blood Gas, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
